definition: Huang Xing (1874-1916), revolutionary politician, close collaborator of Sun Yat-sen, prominent in the 1911 Xinhai Revolution 辛亥革命[Xin1 hai4 Ge2 ming4], murdered in Shanghai in 1916
surname Huang or Hwang
yellow/pornographic/to fall through
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
surname Xing

sentences.english: Mayor Huang Xingguo presides over the conference and speaks.
sentences.chinese: 市长黄兴国主持会议并讲话。

sentences.english: Huangxing walking street is also called Sanxiang business first street, which can be of inner street and outer street.
sentences.chinese: 黄兴路步行街具有“三湘商业第一街”的美誉。

definition: Song Jiaoren (1882-1913), politician of the revolutionary party involved in the 1911 Xinhai revolution, murdered in Shanghai in 1913
Cai E (1882-1916), originator of the National protection army of 1915
Chen Tianhua (1875-1905), anti-Qing revolutionary from Hunan, drowned himself in Japan in 1905
the original name of 孫中山|孙中山[Sun1 Zhong1 shan1], Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3]
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
opposing Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯 in War of national protection 1915-1916/same as 反袁鬥爭|反袁斗争
Chen Duxiu (1879-1942), co-founder of the Chinese Communist Party in 1921
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
Tang Shaoyi (1862-1939), politician and diplomat
anti-Qing revolutionary party set up in 1904 under Cai Yuanpei 蔡元培/same as 復古會|复古会
Tan Sitong (1865-1898), Qing writer and politician, one of the Six Gentlemen Martyrs 戊戌六君子 of the unsuccessful reform movement of 1898
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
Cai Yuanpei (1868-1940), liberal educationalist, studied in Germany, president of Peking University 1917-19, minister of education for Guomindang
Xiong Chengji (1887-1910), anti-Qing revolutionary and martyr
Zhang Zhizhong (1890-1969), National Revolutionary Army general
Zou Rong (1885-1905), a martyr of the anti-Qing revolution, died in jail in 1905
